issues.summary: [Honeycomb] Fix excessive span generated from Place Order handler
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

There are several trace spans triggered from checkout success and error handlers compared to the actual spans generated from the place order fetch.

Instead, they should match near-same (ideally the same) amount of spans.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Ensure checkout error and success handlers are spamming the correctly trace spans.

*Testing Requirements:*

*Affected Brands:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Accessibility Requirements:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Developer Notes:*

The root cause might be the {{useCheckoutSuccessHandler}} and {{useCheckoutErrorHandler}}be rendered and re-creating a new span reference.

Another possibility might be the memoized callback returned from both hooks, be defined with reference types as dependences. This will result in the callback be re-created each time that the hooks above be rendered and re-create the spans again and again.

Board: [https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/board/snpnbrS3LW6|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/board/snpnbrS3LW6]

Honeycomb Queries:

* Checkout Order
** Query: [https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/tLDrAiePcEs|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/tLDrAiePcEs]
** Source: [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/data-access/checkout/checkout.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/data-access/checkout/checkout.ts] 
* VMS' checkout handlers
** Success:
*** Query: [https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/board-query/vGwstVudUA7/result/uReYkpL8cuf?cstype_0=stat|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/board-query/vGwstVudUA7/result/uReYkpL8cuf?cstype_0=stat]
*** Source: [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-checkout/express-checkout/hooks/useCheckoutSuccessHandler.ts|https://github.com/hell

issues.summary: [KTLO] Add to cart doesn't work on bundles for VMS subscribers
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description:*

As an active VMS subscriber, I want to be able to add bundles to my subscription.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in as a VMS subscriber
# Navigate to /products page
# Try to add any bundle to your subscription
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Expected result:*

# Bundle modal should be closed.
# The selected bundle should be added to the cart.
# Sliding cart should open to give the related feedback to the user.
# User should checkout to update their subscription (To discuss: how does it affect the subscription patch?)

*Testing Requirements:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Actual result:*

“Add to cart” CTA doesn’t do anything.

!Screen Recording 2026-01-16 at 14.56.23.mov|width=835,alt="Screen Recording 2026-01-16 at 14.56.23.mov"!


{panel}

issues.summary: [Technical Debt] Refactor how calculate prices is used to avoid 429 errors
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

After investigation in [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/RTEVMS-2113|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/RTEVMS-2113|smart-link]  , we identified the 429 has been consistent, even though it’s not happening for all the customers, there is evidence that this error can impact the conversion and customer experience.

For further details, please review the context and evidence on [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Zjz9iL6NWmPVaVmtW9hZOvSGEJvtNuBbNgX7jVDgJtc/edit?tab=t.0|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Zjz9iL6NWmPVaVmtW9hZOvSGEJvtNuBbNgX7jVDgJtc/edit?tab=t.0|smart-link] 

Some ideas are:

* Migrate /gw/calculate endpoint to /gw/calculate/prospect/batch and optimize calculation calls: (/) 
* Review and optimize caching strategies for price and voucher data ⏲️ 
* Implement robust error handling and user feedback for voucher and price services ⏲️ 
* Establish long-term monitoring and alerting for conversion-critical endpoints and error rates ⏲️ 


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Refactor the codebase to utilize the /gw/calculate/prospect/batch endpoint for grouped calculation calls, similar to other brands like Factor and HelloFresh. This aims to reduce the overall number of API requests to the calculation service.
* Evaluate existing caching mechanisms, particularly in the context of the /gw/calculate endpoint and the issues observed with "Disable cache" during replication. Optimize caching to reduce unnecessary API calls and improve performance without causing stale data issues.
* Implement comprehensive monitoring in tools like HoneyComb to track error rates (specifically 429s and 403s) for /gw/calculate, /factorform/products, and other critical conversion endpoints over a longer period (e.g., 6 months). Set up alerts for significant increases in error rates.

* *Affected Brands:*

Factor Form VMS
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Developer Notes:*

* According to [HoneyComb|h

issues.summary: Coach Marks should not appear on Settings
issues.description:
*Coachmarks* is a user onboarding and guidance system that displays contextual tooltips, dialogs, and nudges to help users understand new features or navigate through important parts of the application. It's essentially an interactive tutorial system that guides users through key workflows.



However, as a customer if I login for first time on Settings, I will see the functionality appearing which does not make sense here given it should appear on Dashboard.

*AC:*

* Coach Mark should appear only on dashboard

*Steps to reproduce the error*:

!image-20250819-131409.png|width=3680,height=2382,alt="image-20250819-131409.png"!

!image-20250819-153106.png|width=1148,height=822,alt="image-20250819-153106.png"!



# Go the staging environment
## [https://www-staging.factor75.com/factorform/settings/gifts-and-offers|https://www-staging.factor75.com/factorform/settings/gifts-and-offers]
# Login in /factorform with a customer that have both memberships (factor && factorform)
## [edwin+sub@hellofresh.ca|mailto:edwin+sub@hellofresh.ca]
## factor1Test$
# Quickly go to /factorform/settings/gifts-and-offers
# Here the coach mark will appear

*How to fix it?*

* Review if we can implement a validation that checks the path and it does not contain settings

[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/31f0e1846bd0da21055519e74179cb8e468824d1/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-coachmarks/dialogs/WelcomeToFactorFormDialog.tsx#L19|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/31f0e1846bd0da21055519e74179cb8e468824d1/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-coachmarks/dialogs/WelcomeToFactorFormDialog.tsx#L19] 

[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/497d93386b094f1cd8aec584ed52b8b1d88a7414/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-coachmarks/CoachmarksProvider.tsx#L20|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/497d93386b094f1cd8aec584ed52b8b1d88a7414/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-we

issues.summary: Quarantine System: vms-cancellation.spec.ts
issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: vms-cancellation.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62725
226 test runs, 32 test failures, 94 test retries, 86.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62725 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #squad-rte-vms-factor-form or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: [After Peak] Remove Black Friday fallback logic
Multi Box Discount A/B Experiment
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h1. Description

This task is to establish the experiment for the *Multi Week Discount* voucher attribution variant.

The experiment should:

* Allocate eligible users between the Control & Variant, defined below
* Prevent allocation of ineligible users

h2. The Experiment

The experiment will include *users with no* *_pre-existing or provided_* *attribution code*. This is described as:

* *Provided*: A user that lands on Factor Form with an {{attrCode}} query parameter
* *Pre-existing*: A user that has an existing voucher value in their browser session’s {{localStorage}} ({{hf_factorform_voucher}})

h3. Allocation

Eligible users will be allocated between two groups:

* *Control*: BAU Single Box Discount of *40% off* first order (BAU voucher: {{FJ-VMS-40OFF-ONSITE}})
* *Variant*: New Multi Week Discount of *30% off W01, 20% off W02* (new voucher: {{TBD}})
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h1. Acceptance Criteria

h2. Dev Setup / Prerequisites

* CUI discount setting created on staging for a {{box1:30%,box2:20%}} discount, on orders above $65
** for staging setup we will only set the discount to apply to our existing bundle SKUS (other skus won’t be discounted, just for testing purposes)
* Sample voucher(s) created and attached to this epic for dev usage

h2. Statsig Setup / Requirements

* The A/B test is set up to measure the *uplift* in 5W, 10W, and 52W *retention* (AOR).
* The A/B test is set up to measure the *reduction in monthly cancellation rates*, particularly after the first box.
* The A/B test is set up to measure the *uplift in Customer Campaign Value* (CCV) for cohorts starting with the multi-box discount

h2. Attribution Handler (Dev)

* Eligible users requesting a fallback (onsite/default) voucher application are *allocated*
* Users with a *_pre-existing or provided_* voucher are *not allocated*

*Experience:*

* Control: BAU discount ({{box1:40%}})
* Variant: {{box1:30%,box2:20%}} discount
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
h1. C

comments.author: Emily Mendelson
comments.body:
h2. Issue Summary

*Problem*: Customers are unable to attach vouchers during checkout, resulting in conversion loss. Error shows "Benefit Attachment failed" with ~3.4% error rate on vms-place-order trace since Aug 30, affecting FJ market.

*Root Cause*: Vouchers have a 2-plan attachment limit enforced by the vouchers service. The system is blocking checkout attempts because customers have pending plans in customer-plans-service preventing voucher attachment to new orders.

*Specific Example*:

*

issues.summary: Introduce Meal Shake & Creatine to VMS assortment
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Overview:* 

We are aiming to add Meal Shake and Creatine products to the VMS offerings.

PRD with additional background: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eqT49tTHK2BG_RIUvEM_7uT6ShaeF5RSZuVP1zXtAFk/edit?tab=t.4w9mu9dyzkup|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eqT49tTHK2BG_RIUvEM_7uT6ShaeF5RSZuVP1zXtAFk/edit?tab=t.4w9mu9dyzkup|smart-link] 
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Goals:* 

* Update All Products page to include 
** Meal Shake - Vanilla
** Meal Shake - Lemon
** Creatine - Unflavored
** Creatine - Peach Mango 
* Create a PDP for Creatine
* Create a PDP for Meal Shake  
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Resources:* 

Figma: [https://www.figma.com/design/bybh4HYm7NI8qgIRGZtnhp/Creatine---Meal-Shake-PDP-re-design?node-id=91-14341&t=5cqpKAcWpvIVi6jT-0|https://www.figma.com/design/bybh4HYm7NI8qgIRGZtnhp/Creatine---Meal-Shake-PDP-re-design?node-id=91-14341&t=5cqpKAcWpvIVi6jT-0|smart-link] 

Product Intake Forms: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rxz1-lOki6j0_XBV73pmogQDjvcLhZQCf2p7XVqxjDo/edit?gid=1539850972#gid=1539850972|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rxz1-lOki6j0_XBV73pmogQDjvcLhZQCf2p7XVqxjDo/edit?gid=1539850972#gid=1539850972|smart-link] 

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1y8IAysj0jpPYbNxi9DMHaSjafcMCplnpFiSoTicnUV4/edit?gid=840021641#gid=840021641|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1y8IAysj0jpPYbNxi9DMHaSjafcMCplnpFiSoTicnUV4/edit?gid=840021641#gid=840021641|smart-link]

issues.summary: [OTP][UAT] Update Welcome Kit copy for SNS orders
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

Daily Greens *Welcome Kit* sections should be updated to communicate that this is for SNS orders only.

Copy should be updated to SNS orders only in the following places:

* Section on {{/products}} page
* Greens product cards on {{/products}} page
* Section on {{/products/greens}} page
* Section on {{/signup}} page

!Screenshot 2025-12-30 at 10.02.00 AM.png|width=321,height=431,alt="Screenshot 2025-12-30 at 10.02.00 AM.png"!

!Screenshot 2025-12-30 at 10.02.11 AM.png|width=448,height=191,alt="Screenshot 2025-12-30 at 10.02.11 AM.png"!

!Screenshot 2025-12-23 at 10.08.51 AM.png|width=939,height=762,alt="Screenshot 2025-12-23 at 10.08.51 AM.png"!

!Screenshot 2025-12-30 at 10.01.46 AM.png|width=1032,height=565,alt="Screenshot 2025-12-30 at 10.01.46 AM.png"!


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Ensure the Welcome Kit copy is updated on Section on the following pages
** {{/products}} page
*** Replace the title “FREE Daily Greens Welcome Kit worth $36“ with “Subscribe and Save: FREE Welcome Kit worth $36“
*** Replace “Free welcome kit with first time purchase of Daily Greens.“ with “Get a free welcome kit with first time subscription order of Daily Greens; Auto-applied at checkout.“
** Greens product cards on {{/products}} page
*** Replace “*Free welcome kit* (worth $36) with first order“ with “*Free welcome kit* (worth $36) with first subscription order“
** Section on {{/products/greens}} page
*** Replace “new customers only“ with “New subscribers only, auto-applied at checkout“
** Section on {{/signup}} page
*** Replace “new customers only“ with “New subscribers only, auto-applied at checkout“
*** Use the attached image to address the updates. 
!Gemini_Generated_Image_yfdpoqyfdpoqyfdp-20260106-191222.png|width=528,height=496,alt="Gemini_Generated_Image_yfdpoqyfdpoqyfdp-20260106-191222.png"!

*Testing Requirements:*

*Affected Brands:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Accessibility Requiremen

comments.body:
[~accountid:6123c40c3ef46a00704cafda] The implemented version doesn’t match with the designs in some ways:

1. The paddings are different
2. The chevron is too far from the text
3. The title is bolded which shouldn’t be
4. The font and font size doesn’t match the designs
5. The warning icon is black which should be amber
6. The link should open in a new tab but opens in the same tab (AC #3)

Implemented version:

!image-20260107-172537.png|width=1058,height=249,alt="image-20260107-172537.png"!

issues.summary: [KTLO] Update the shipping fee on the sign up page
[All Products Page] update banner discount copy on product cards based on the discount type
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

As a RTE active customer who lands on Factor Form products page with a 50% year voucher applied, I should have consistent discount info over all voucher discount communications along the funnel.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Voucher offer should be properly contextualized over the all offer elements in all products and product details pages.
* The {{FJ-VMS-50OFF1YR-RTE-PEAK}} should present 1 Year 50% discount communication for RTE actives in the banner and other offer banners (product cards in all products page and quantity option in PDP greens)
* The communication for the fallback voucher, 40% off first order, should also be in conformance over all offer communication elements.

*Testing Requirements:*

* Offer presented by product cards should be the same provided by PPS service
* Offer presented by quantity options in the Greens page, should be the same given by the PPS service

*Affected Brands:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Accessibility Requirements:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Developer Notes:*

This update enables discount banners in the card to present custom discount communication based on the discount communication ID provided in the URL.

To enable retro compatibility, we should ensure to handle cases where no discount communication id is attributed or when it does, to do not show the incorrect discount communication.

Required changes: 

* CUI → Discount Communication: Use some suitable key to provide the copy and add the placeholder for discount.
** We should use some not used field that is suitable for this purpose on VMS, or request support from owners (not found yet) to include the fields we need in the page
** Currently, this communication is done via Applanga only
* On Web, consolidate all SKUs that shows discount banner in the {{price-presentation/v2/discount_communication/voucher/}} service to obtain the copy for the given discount communication.
{pane

comments.author: Hamed Karimian
comments.body: [~accountid:62d18d3c078104d0866dc9b0] can you please update the ticket to also address the fallback mechanism we discussed yesterday?  i.e., if user is not an active Factor customer, all banners should properly fallback on the default “Limited time offer: 40% off first order!“

comments.author: Jan Leite
comments.body: Consider it done [~accountid:712020:4b6a0b29-53dc-45ce-82fb-0ac6a91e6feb], thanks for highlight it.

comments.author: Edwin Torres
comments.body:
Comments after validation:

# The {{defaultDiscountCommId: '7e6a6f43-0db8-46ae-8aa9-b4aa320ead87',}} needs to support the new {{6744ac0f-e6d7-4332-a3bd-70a1cafd1b15}} that contains the year message. – I'll work on that extension in the existing an Open PR.
# There is an issue with a copy on dashboard, it shows like {{500%}} somewhere with a wrong calculus. – I'll work on that one too separately.
